physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Physical examination showed no rash or lymphadenopathy. Left conjunctiva injected; both pupils reacted normally. Neurological examination findings included bilateral lower motor neuron facial weakness, mild proximal leg weakness with 4-power in hip flexion, 4+ at the knees, normal tone, globally absent reflexes with flexor plantar responses. Loss of pain sensation was elicited in both legs in a high stocking distribution extending to the upper thigh; position sense was intact.
Full recovery noted with regained full power including facial muscles.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Sensory symptoms had resolved after 14 days of treatment, with full recovery within a month after discharge.
